abstract: The message from some top bank executives is clear: give us time and we’ll be able to handle the write-downs we may need to take on the sketchy assets on our books.
snippet: The message from some top bank executives is clear: give us time and we’ll be able to handle the write-downs we may need to take on the sketchy assets on our books.
lead_paragraph: American bankers are fighting — for the right to be zombies. You wouldn’t know it by last week’s rally in bank stocks. But it’s one plausible interpretation of comments by the chief executives of Citigroup and Bank of America playing up the earnings power of their respective institutions.

headline.main: Banks Can Live as Walking Dead
headline.print_headline: Banks Can Live as Walking Dead

byline.original: By Rob Cox and Robert Cyran

abstract: Among the biggest recipients were Société Générale, Deutsche Bank and Goldman Sachs, all of which were owed money from credit default swaps.
snippet: Among the biggest recipients were Société Générale, Deutsche Bank and Goldman Sachs, all of which were owed money from credit default swaps.
lead_paragraph: Amid rising pressure from Congress and taxpayers, the American International Group on Sunday released the names of dozens of financial institutions that benefited from the Federal Reserve’s decision last fall to save the giant insurer from collapse with a huge rescue loan.

headline.main: A.I.G. Lists Banks It Paid With U.S. Bailout Funds
headline.print_headline: A.I.G. Lists Firms To Which It Paid Taxpayer Money

abstract: Some investors may fear the worst for their bank bonds. But the government is in no mood to let another major financial institution fail.
snippet: Some investors may fear the worst for their bank bonds. But the government is in no mood to let another major financial institution fail.
lead_paragraph: Should bank bondholders really be heading for the exits? In recent weeks the prices of some troubled banks’ subordinated debt have declined sharply and the cost of insuring it against default has risen. For example, some Citigroup and Bank of America subordinated debt has been trading, despite investment-grade ratings, at around 70 cents to 85 cents on the dollar, down in some cases from an earlier level above 90 cents.

headline.main: Bank Bonds Have a Sturdy Footing
